miniaesdemo

Class MiniAES

  • java.lang.Object
    • miniaesdemo.MiniAES

  • public class MiniAES
extends java.lang.Object

    This class implements all of the necessary steps to encrypt and decrypt strings with the Mini AES algorithm.

    Since:
    0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MiniAES()
      The constructor is empty, this class doesn't contain any variables outside of its methods.

        The constructor is empty, this class doesn't contain any variables outside of its methods.

    • Method Detail

      • addRoundKey

        private static int[] addRoundKey(int[] plainText,
                                 int[] key)

        This method takes a 4 nibble segment and applies a given round key to it. This is done by getting the result of applying the XOR operation to each individual nibble.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        key - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a single round key.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles with the round key applied to it.

      • nibbleSub

        private static int[] nibbleSub(int[] plainText)

        This method substitutes the contents of the plainText array with values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getNibbleSubValue(int) method.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles substituted with values from the NibbleSub table.

      • inverseNibbleSub

        private static int[] inverseNibbleSub(int[] plainText)

        This method substitutes the contents of the plainText array with values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getInverseNibbleSubValue(int) method.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles substituted with values from the inverse NibbleSub table.

      • subBytes

        private static int[] subBytes(int[] plainText)

        This method substitutes the contents of the plainText array with values from the S-BOX table.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles substituted with values from the S-BOX table.

      • inverseSubBytes

        private static int[] inverseSubBytes(int[] plainText)

        This method substitutes the contents of the plainText array with values from the inverse S-BOX table.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles substituted with values from the inverse S-BOX table.

      • shiftRows

        private static int[] shiftRows(int[] plainText)

        This method swaps the last two elements of the plaintext.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles with swapped the last two elements.

      • mixColumns

        private static int[] mixColumns(int[] plainText)

        This method multiplies each element by an element of a constant array, the result of this multiplication is retrieved from Tables.MULTIPLICATION_TABLE.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles multiplied by the constant array.

      • mixColumnsAES

        private static int[] mixColumnsAES(int[] plainText)

        This method multiplies each element of the plaintext by a Rijndael constant matrix.

        Each value is multiplied by a row of the constant matrix. Each multiplication retrieves a value from a multiplication table.

        Example: Tables.getMUL2Value(int).

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles multiplied by the constant matrix.

      • inverseMixColumnsAES

        private static int[] inverseMixColumnsAES(int[] cipherText)

        This method multiplies each element of the plaintext by a Rijndael inverse constant matrix.

        Each value is multiplied by a row of the inverse constant matrix. Each multiplication retrieves a value from a multiplication table.

        Example: Tables.getMUL14Value(int).

        Parameters:
        cipherText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the ciphertext.
        Returns:
        Returns the resulting array of 4 nibbles multiplied by the constant matrix.

      • Encrypt

        public static java.lang.String Encrypt(java.lang.String plainText,
                                       java.lang.String key)

        This method encapsulates the operations done in the encryption process of the Mini-AES. The process is broken down into a few steps:

        1. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the initial key to the plain text.
        2. nibbleSub(int[]): Substituting the values in the result of the addRoundKey(int[], int[]) step with values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getNibbleSubValue(int) method.
        3. shiftRows(int[]): Shifting the last two elements of the result of the nibbleSub(int[]) step.
        4. mixColumns(int[]): Multiplying the result the shiftRows(int[]) step by a constant array.
        5. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the first round key to the result of the mixColumns(int[]) step.
        6. nibbleSub(int[]): Substituting the values in the result of the addRoundKey(int[], int[]) step with values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getNibbleSubValue(int) method.
        7. shiftRows(int[]): Shifting the last two elements of the result of the nibbleSub(int[]) step.
        8. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the second round key to the result of the shiftRows(int[]) step.
        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        key - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a single round key.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted binary string that stores the ciphertext.

      • Encrypt

        public static javafx.util.Pair Encrypt(java.lang.String plainText,
                                       boolean generateRandomKey)
                                throws java.lang.Exception

        Encrypt

        This method works the same way as the Encrypt(String plainText, String key) method, but it generates a random key instead of the user inputting one.

        Parameters:
        plainText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the plaintext.
        generateRandomKey - A boolean indicating if the user wants a random key to be generated.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted binary string that stores the ciphertext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on false generateRandomKey value.

      • Decrypt

        public static java.lang.String Decrypt(java.lang.String cipherText,
                                       java.lang.String key)

        This method encapsulates the operations done in the decryption process of the Mini-AES. The process is broken down into a few steps:

        1. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the second round key to the result of the shiftRows(int[]) step.
        2. inverseNibbleSub(int[]): Substituting the values in the result of the addRoundKey(int[], int[]) step with the values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getInverseNibbleSubValue(int) method.
        3. shiftRows(int[]): Shifting the last two elements of the result of the (inverseNibbleSub(int[])) step.
        4. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the first round key to the result of the shiftRows(int[]) step.
        5. mixColumns(int[]): Multiplying the result the addRoundKey(int[], int[]) step by a constant array.
        6. inverseNibbleSub(int[]): Substituting the values in the result of the addRoundKey(int[], int[]) step with the values from the Tables.NIBBLE_SUB_TABLE table using the Tables.getInverseNibbleSubValue(int) method.
        7. shiftRows(int[]): Shifting the last two elements of the result of the inverseNibbleSub(int[]) step.
        8. addRoundKey(int[], int[]): Adding the initial key to the result of the shiftRows(int[]) step.
        Parameters:
        cipherText - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a segment of the cipherText.
        key - An Integer Array of four elements that stores a single round key.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted binary string that stores the plainText.

      • EncryptText

        public static java.lang.String EncryptText(java.lang.String plainText,
                                           java.lang.String key)

        This method divides an ASCII string into a matrix of 4 columns and however many rows are necessary. It proceeds to encrypt every segment using a user provided binary key. It follows the same process as the Encrypt(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.

        Parameters:
        plainText - A string that stores the plaintext.
        key - A string that stores a binary key.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted hexadecimal string that stores the ciphertext.

      • EncryptText

        public static javafx.util.Pair EncryptText(java.lang.String plainText,
                                           boolean generateRandomKey)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception

        This method divides an ASCII string into a matrix of 4 columns and however many rows are necessary. It proceeds to encrypt every segment using a randomly generated binary key. It follows the same process as the EncryptText(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.

        Parameters:
        plainText - A string that stores the plaintext.
        generateRandomKey - A boolean indicating if the user wants a random key to be generated.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted hexadecimal string that stores the ciphertext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - on false generateRandomKey value.

      • DecryptText

        public static java.lang.String DecryptText(java.lang.String cipherText,
                                           java.lang.String key)

        This method divides an ASCII string into a matrix of 4 columns and however many rows are necessary. It proceeds to decrypt every segment using a user provided binary key. It follows the same process as the Decrypt(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.

        Parameters:
        cipherText - A hexadecimal string that stores the ciphertext.
        key - A string that stores a binary key.
        Returns:
        Returns an encrypted hexadecimal string that stores the ciphertext.
